fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-11241].
  {panel}

All Plugins (bundled and from the repository) that have been disabled have an entry in table BANDANA where BANDANAKEY is plugin.manager.state.Map.
For Example if the pagetree macro had been installed but is currently disabled would be reflected in BANDANAVALUE

<map>
  <entry>
    <string>bnpparibas.confluence.pagetree</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
</map>

	It turns out that the <boolean> expression is not really evaluated. When the plugin name is present in the map it is considered as disabled. Once the plugin is enabled again the entry in this row disappears. A clarification in the naming and the map structure is suggested to reflect the actual behavior.
fields.summary: Disabled Plugins have true/false option in Database but has no effect

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-11194].
  {panel}

Confluence needs to support opening a link in a new window.  

Although I admit that it probably shouldn't use target as that's deprecated, it should still do it (article on standards compliant way: http://www.sitepoint.com/article/standards-compliant-world).

Wordpress does it and I use it all the time.  Within a week of us rolling out Confluence at my company, people have started asking for it.  

I am aware of the CONF-1210, CONF-7045, and CONF-6947 marked "Will not fix," but this is a simple feature found in competing products which users find useful and I wanted to open it again and get votes behind it.

The {link-to} macro doesn't do this for external links so it doesn't satisfy this requirement.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of September 19, 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA} 
Hi everyone, 

Thank you for your ongoing feedback on this issue. On behalf of the Confluence team I would like to apologize for the changing status of this request. After many hours of discussion with design and product management, and after some engineering prototyping and testing, we have decided to close this issue as we do not plan to release this feature.

We aim to make our users' experience as friction-free as possible, and although being able to control the ways of opening links would be useful to many of you, it could easily lead to an inconsistent experience for users.

If your use of Confluence is in fact enhanced by opening particular links in a new window/tab then please consider using one of the existing solutions from our Marketplace (unfortunately they're not available for Cloud instances): 

* [ServiceRocket Linking Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.customware.confluence.plugin.linking]
* [External Link Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ch.bitvoodoo.confluence.plugins.externallinks]

Cheers,

Adam Barnes
Confluence Product Manager
{panel}
fields.summary: Open links in new window

  {panel}

After upgrading to Confluence 2.7.1, emails sent to users who use Microsoft Entourage 2008 (Macintosh) as their email client sometimes (maybe always) show up blank.  A look at the actual message (using Message->Source in Entourage menu) reveals that the message contains all of the right data. The same message on the IMAP server downloaded to alternate email clients (including MS Outlook on a PC, iPhone Mail, and Apple Mail) renders correctly.

There is however another user who has reported the same problem with MS Outlook, though this is not consistent with other users. At least two users using Microsoft Entourage at our site are receiving the 'blank' emails. Saving the message in its original format using Entourage again reveals that the contents of the message are there in the message.

A hunch that this problem was an HTML display problem led me to edit the message and remove all of the stylesheet information (removing the {{<style>...</style>}} elements from the HTML inside the message. Sure enough, that edited email message displayed correctly in Entourage.  Also, switching to 'Text' format for notification emails allows the emails to be viewed, providing further evidence the problem is an HTML display issue only.

So it seems that the problem is with Microsoft Entourage (latest update to MS Office/Entourage 12.0.1 didn't fix the issue). However, the fact that it seems to occur on at least one instance of MS Outlook leads me to believe that perhaps something in the underlying stylesheet could be adjusted to work with Entourage and Outlook reliably.  If the stylesheet could be updated so that it renders properly in Entourage (probably some minor bug in Entourage/MS Office HTML rendering), this would be most desirable.

It would be nice if confluence used the same mechanism as JIRA regarding the distribution. So instead of downloading a WAR file, you download a tar.gz file which you need to build yourself using a build.sh. I came across this when integrating confluence with crowd and I needed to open the war file myself and needed modify the contents of the war file.

The buildable distribution has the following advantages:

- It is clear what you changed in contrast to the original by using the edit-webapp feature
- You don't have to open and zip up the war file manually, which can be error phrone
- different atlassian products have same distribution

From the space admin interface, when granting permissions to an LDAP group with the help of magnifying glass button, a new window pops up, allowing to do a search to retrieve the group to be granted.
This window contains the form to do the actual search and a paginated list of all existing groups.
To create and display this list, Confluence run a full LDAP request (cn=*) before we choose the search pattern (have a look in the attachment, request #1). This 1st request is potentially heavy. Is it possible to avoid it by simply removing the initial display of the groups list? Just keep the search box at the init, and then display the resultset retrieved by the currently second request (have a look in the attachment, request #2). 

Thank you,
Ludovic

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-10953].
  {panel}

It may be of interest to some of the customers to replace Multicast with {{"Well known Addresses"}} using Unicast. 

It could assist in bypassing known problems caused by using multicast and smart 'Cisco' switches, for example. Also some companies policy may not allow or support multicasting in their departments.

[Cluster Troubleshooting page|
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Cluster+Troubleshooting] suggests that some customers are using [WKA|http://wiki.tangosol.com/display/COH32UG/well-known-addresses] instead of Multicast. The page in question:

The Tangosol docs suggesting to place the specified changes in confluence_home/tangosol-coherence-override.xml

{code}
<unicast-listener>
    <!--
    Note: Specifying one or more "well known" addresses (WKA) will disable
    all multicast communication. In this case, for a member to join the cluster
    it will either have to be a WKA or there will have to be at least one WKA
    member running.
    Note: The "localhost" setting may not work on systems that define
    localhost as the loopback address; in that case, specify the machine
    name or the specific IP address.
    -->
    <well-known-addresses>
      <socket-address id='1'>
        <address/>
        <port>8088</port>
      </socket-address>
    </well-known-addresses>
    <address>localhost</address>
    <port>8088</port>
    <port-auto-adjust>true</port-auto-adjust>
    <packet-buffer>
      <maximum-packets>1428</maximum-packets>
    </packet-buffer>
    <priority>8</priority>
  </unicast-listener>
{code}
fields.summary: Support unicast addressing in cluster when well-known-addresses WKA are defined

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-10845].
  {panel}

In one customer's environment, their virus checker occasional hangs the confluence server for up to 3 seconds. During one such time, a customer tried to add a page to favourites 3 times and thus when the server began processing, it ended up adding three rows into the content_label table. Now when trying to remove the page from favourites, it results in the error covered by CONF-13516. The customer should not be able to get into a situation like this. 

To prevent this situation, we can add more constraints on the database level.

A similar problem occurs with the content table for pages and blog posts. There are no database restrictions on page title + space key + version uniqueness for pages, so there's a race condition where two requests to save a page come in at exactly the same time, check for an existing version -- don't find one -- and proceed with saving the new version in duplicate.

However, implementing this in the CONTENT table is a tad difficult, where the restrictions would need to be based on the CONTENTTYPE column being "PAGE" or "BLOGPOST". We can't implement this in a database independent way with Hibernate. The CONTENT table would need to be split up by class to implement this for all customers, which raises a whole host of other problems.

Our current recommendation is that customers investigate implementing the database constraints themselves if they are interested in getting this additional level of security. In general, Confluence is designed to handle the duplicates gracefully rather than prevent them in the first place. (Hence CONF-13516 where multiple labels caused problems is fixed as a bug separate to this improvement.)
fields.summary: Additional database constraints to prevent erroneous duplication of the same row

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-10668].
  {panel}

I have a user who wants to use the site search that allows the user to enter their own query, whilst at the same time only looking at one space and  a specific label.  This feature is not available in any of the search features available in confluence, either core features or plugins (including those available from third parties).  

What is required is the ability to specify which type(s) of content that should be search when the livesearch is executed.  This should also include the labels used to desribe content.  

For example:  

*        {livesearch:id=1|spaceKey=KEY|type=label}  would search labels only 
*        {livesearch:id=1|spaceKey=KEY|type=page, news} would search pages and news only
fields.summary: Live search to be able to only search labels in a specific space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-10666].
  {panel}

It may perhaps we useful to have a way to disable current licence (under specific circumstances) 
Further, we could improve the way how licence is deployed.

Both of the above may be possible to achieve by having a tool that generates licences in a form of a jar file (or an executable). This jar file can be shipped to a customer instead of a 'textual' description of the licence code. 
Customer that may deploy this {{jar}} and it will have the licence key embedded in it. Thus allowing the application to be instantiated with a valid licence.

Further, we can have a jar file that would contain functionality to disable licence when a 'refund' licence is used or a new licence is provided when the previous one has not expired yet. The class inside the jar can do 'all the work' to check and verify the currently deployed licence on that application, compare it with it's server id and perform all necessary tasks to disabling it's use and substituting it with a new licence.
fields.summary: Option to Deploy and Disable Licence more conveniently

Hello,
 
I am trying to create a restricted calnedar on our team wiki site. The current command I am using for a tab named 'R1 Schedule' is
 
{calendar:id=R1Schedule\|title=CCIE Rack 1 Schedule}
 
I would like to have the same exact layout and options except for one slight difference. When one adds an event, I would like the time frame to be limited. Normal users are to only be able to add an event from the current day, up to a maximum of 14 days
 
For example. If I come to add an event, I can only add an event for today, and not a future day. Also, there would be a drop down box that allows me to select the numbers of days I would be scheduling the event for.  ie. 1, 2, 3, ..., 6, 7     and possibly have the drop down box up to 14 days.
 
An example of some code I have viewed from a website I have seen is:

<select name="daysneeded" onChange="addDays(this.options[this.options.selectedIndex].value)">
					<option value="initial">initial</option>
				</select>

This creates a drop down box with preset values; the values I need are from 1 up to 14 days. The header above that drop down box is "Days Needed"

Lastly, I also need to allow an administrator to be able to add events at any time, current or future. This is for reservation purposes.
 
I appreciate your time and help.
